Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but very unprofessional staff”
Reviews.Author: CristinaBadea
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my boyfriend at the Empire Palace for 2 nights at the end of march. The hotel is placed in a nice area, all attractions are within walking distance (except for the Vatican). Even Termini station is within walking distance. We didn't use public transportation at all. The hotel is lovely, it has clean and well kept rooms, a bit small however. I would have liked a more spacious room. Also, the breakfast they serve is very good. Unfortunately, the staff wasn't as nice as we expected. They seemed very money hungry and made no effort to hide that and be polite. We had to ask for the wireless password two times before they actually gave us the correct one and they didn't bother to apologize. The they before we left, they told us Rome will be messed up by an organized protest and we won't be able to get to the airport unless we ask them to call a special taxi for us. The taxi had a 40 euros fee and we would also have to pay the hotel butler for carrying our bags (3 euros) and of course, there was a "caller tax" of 5 euros. We kindly declined the offer and the next day we took a bus to the airport for 12 euros each. No signs of riots or protest whatsoever. We had our vacation pre paid. However, at checkout, they asked us to pay again because they were not able to get the money from the agency we booked with. We showed a printed confirmation which stated everything was paid, yet they insisted. We insisted as well and finally in our presence they made another try to get the money from the agency's account and it instantly worked. Again, no apologies. All in all we had a great time, but in spite of nice rooms and good restaurant, I wouldn't chose this hotel again. The people who work there need to be more careful with their guests. I expected a lot more from a 4 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bob G
Reviews.Content: My wife and spent four nights at this hotel and loved it. It's located within walking distance of just about everything you want to see in Rome, but located in a neighborhood off the beaten path. The staff is very friendly and responsive, if not always knowledgeable about the quality of the restaurants in their area. We found several very fine restaurants within a block of the hotel. The room was very nice and very clean. Furnishings could use an update, but this is a minor quibble. The daily breakfast, included with the price of the room, is fantastic. The bar is very cool too. Overall, this hotel offers a great experience for the price and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A romantic stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Chris B B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was situated around 15 mins walk from Rome termini. Although tucked away in a side street it was easy to find and a quite location. The hotels has its own resturant but we ate out in the local area which had a number of excellant resturants to choose from at reasonable prices. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful, the rooms were small but more than adequate and certainly clean, if not a little dated. The buffet breakfast catered for all tastes and certainly set you up for a days walk around Rome. I would stay at this hotel again and have already recommended as a good choice to me nearest family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but location is a bit hard to find for a first-timer”
Reviews.Author: Sugiato
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel but located in small street. The room is rather small but clean and has a classic touch with the wood furniture, there is no free wi-fi in the room, only in the lobby and restaurant area. Breakfast is included in the price and the food was great with the inclusion of omelette, bacon, and sausages, on top of the standard breakfast (pastries, cereals, fruits). The location is in a small street (off the main street), so it will be hard to find for a first-timer without a detailed map. However, once you got the local map from the hotel it is all good, the closest metro is about 10-15 minutes walk (not close but not far for those who are not used to walk - i normally drive, I'm lazy)

Reviews.Title: “Functional - it just works - good location”
Reviews.Author: kiwi400
Reviews.Content: Not a business hotel - more touristy- English speaking front desk but typical Italian confusion about, well, nearly everything. Ensure your car service is organized- mine showed up claiming he could not take a credit card (they pay high fees) - confirm twice that you can use a card and get the name of the person you spoke to. An amazing restaurant nearby Trattoria Cordona - OMG - have the burretta (mozarella) starter....Room small....functional. Wireless nternet is spotty - free.

Reviews.Title: “Our Suite was Disappointing ..............but breakfast good !”
Reviews.Content: We stayed there mid february ; I’m EXTREMELY disappointed with this Hotel. It’s not my first time in Rome nor in Italy .I know the hotel are other priced but ” OUR SUITE was NOT up to four star standard”!!! The room side of the suite was extremely cold at night. Some kind of issue with the windows. Even when they are closed the air still go through !! They obviously never hear of double glazing !! There were also cracks on the wall , something that looks like damp & cracks on walls near the windows ! broken door handle ! I’ve taken picture of the biggest one ,check it OUT !! Some furniture had scratches /scuffs marks ! No WIFI access in the room !! but they had an outdate internet access via the tv . To be fair the rest wasn’t so bad and breakfast was pretty good . But this is an another OVERATED hotel ! Would I come back and spend another £855 for 3 nights ? Nop !!!

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest, Unprofessional Management; Tacky and Smelly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Javier A
Reviews.Content: After a lovely vacation through Italy primarily staying with hotels belonging to the Small Luxury Hotels of the world collection, we arrived to the Empire Palace for the last few nights of our trip. The hotel's eclectic, outdated and tasteless decor was coupled with an unpleasant scent. We politely told management that the hotel didn't meet our standard and we wanted to move to another property. The hotel manager, SILVANO FIORONI, came to apologize and reassure us that we wouldn't be charged for leaving. He provided me with his business card and asked us to not divulge our experience / impressions of his hotel. Mr. FIORONI billed our credit card, was unresponsive to our emails and phone calls and didn't honor his word. We contacted Small Luxury Hotels and they recently informed us that this property is being REMOVED FROM SMALL LUXURY HOTELS for failing to uphold the standards. This hotel is managed by crooks and is tasteless, but not odorless. STAY AWAY FROM EMPIRE PALACE.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: 3-fl-oz-com
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a peaceful neighborhood in easy walking distance of the main attractions. It is very small, with a friendly staff. The rooms are small but very comfortable and very pleasant. It is a real find!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Julie K
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Italy and did not know what to expect in hotels. We were very pleased with the Empire Palace. Everything was clean and efficiently run. The breakfast buffet was good and gave plenty of choices: eggs, meats, breads, yogurt, juices and coffees. It's not in the center of things but I ended up appreciating that. Housekeeping was efficient and thorough. When we had questions about how to get to places, they were helpful. The doorman was funny and friendly. We wanted to take him with us. If we were to go back to Rome, we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thongchai4286
Reviews.Content: Booked through SLH and got a nice upgrade to a Junior Suite. The room was a little dated and old looking but still very nice. Staff were very helpful providing maps and advice. A little bit away from the craziness of the tourist areas but not too far and a nice walk. About 20 mins walk from the Spanish steps. Food was very nice. Very strangely designed shower, flooded the bathroom every time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoyBridgewater
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, helpful friendly staff. Good breakfast. Nice location - many sights within walkng distance. Spent two nights there before cruise in October 2011. Booked through Celebrity cruise line.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, friendly, eggs for BF, near many inexpensive good restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Karlegge
Reviews.Content: My wife and I there 4 nights. Roughly $1,000, which seemed fair for what we had.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: DriCa_SP
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome in June/2011 to find a taxi strike... but we were able to find a shuttle that took us to our hotel very quickly. The hotel is great... it has that boutique appeal and it is in a very good neighbourhood concerning safety and the restaurants that are near were just great. We walked to Fontana di Trevi, Piazza di Spagna and all attractions or used the subway, but taxis are easy to find when they are not on strike.... Although this hotel is not in the middle of the things, for us it was great because allowed us silent nights even with open windows... and there is nothing better in the morning than to awake to the birds singing. Bedroom was small but suited us perfectly, clean bathroom with great toiletteries ... the only problem was that to my opinion pillows were just rock hard.... but with all the things to see and do in Rome I did not ask for it to be replaced so... perhaps I should not be complaining now... :). Photos on their website are true to what you will find there. Breakfast was included and it is a very good way to start the day. Internet was expensive but it had a good speed. Rome is a wonderful city and I can't wait to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: In_the_shade53449
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel prior to our cruise. We had a wonderful time and found the hotel to be a perfect location. Great restaurants nearby as well. We felt safe at all times. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dougt1957
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights before a transatlantic cruise. The room was nice, bed comfortable, and the staff was friendly and helpful. Easy walking distance to historic sights. Clean room was decent size. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Empire Palace Hotel - Great Rome Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Delaw
Reviews.Content: We booked a three night pre-cruise stay at Empire Palace Hotel through Celebrity Cruise Line. We probably would not have "found" this Hotel but for this booking prompt on Celebrity Cruise's package page. We so appreciate the introduction! The Empire Palace is on Via Aureliana. It is a member of the Small Luxury Hotels group. Via Aureliana is in a very safe and lovely business district just east of the Trevi Fountain and adjacent to the Borghese Gardens. Our room was very clean and comfortably outfitted: very comfortable bed, to-die for sheets, well equipped bathroom, comfy robes, extra blankets. Housekeeping was terrific - always replacing and keeping us fully stocked on towels, soaps, etc. There was evening turn down service: chocolates and bedside linen foot mats placed out each night. Our package included daily breakfast in the Hotel's dining room. It was a buffet but very delicious with high quality offerings. Even the milk for our coffee arrived heated in little creamers. The Hotel is in a refurbished "palace" so has some interesting architectural features. There is a charming bar (inside and outside interior courtyard seating). Drinks were high quality and not any more expensive than what we pay state-side. Additionally, they were always accompanied by tasty appetizers at no further charge! There are a number of very, very good small restaurants within a very safe walking distance of the Hotel. La Lampada Restaurant, just around the corner from the Empire Palace, is particularly delicious. These were all casual places with decent prices (@ 10 to 12 Euros for a pasta course; good bottle of local red wine @ 16 Euros - dinner with appetizer, pasta main course and wine ran around 50 Euros for us). The Hotel staff were friendly and helpful and many spoke English. Our hotel rate was a fantastic $700 USD for all three nights. The only negative and it really is a faint negative was the size of our room. It was a tad cramped. But we were on a corner so it was open and airy. The room next to ours was a lovely two room suite so there are larger rooms available. There are also smaller rooms available as a single bed - very convent/dorm size but appeared totally adequate and comfortable. We were on the front corner of the Hotel on the second floor and there was some street noise in the early evening and early morning. It did not bother us, however. Taxi rate to the Vatican was $15 Euros. You could easily walk to the Trevi Fountain and to Via Piave where there are a number of interesting shops and stores. We would return to the Empire Palace - cruise or not - on our next trip to Rome. It was clean, safe and lovely. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury! So pampered!”
Reviews.Author: PatsyAverett
Reviews.Content: Enjoying Rome, Italy via Empire Palace Hotel was wonderful! If one is looking for a true 5 star experience, this is for you. All amenities included, food was outstanding, so easy to visit the Vatican, and all that Rome offers. The bathroom was quite large for a European bath, and the toiletries were high quality. Moreover, big fluffy robes were given to us as well as slippers, which were great after a day of touring followed by a wonderful bath. Room service was truly a nice amenity as the food was first rate as well as the service. A 20 per cent surcharge is tagged to your bill which was known by us before hand. A crisp clean well appointed dining room greeted us followed by good service and great food. All hotel employees spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a quiet but accessbile location”
Reviews.Author: ppg9711
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights pre-cruise. Our room was a 2-room suite yet reasonably priced (295 Euro) considering the area. I liked the fact that the clothing armoire locked (with removable key) in addition to having a lockable safe inside of it. The breakfast was good and dining area pleasant. Front desk staff were very helpful. The hotel pre-arranged transfers, at add'l cost, from airport to hotel and from hotel to port. The drivers arrived on time and were courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Gasman43
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as part of a package with Celebrity Cruises. Quite a nice central traditional Italian hotel. Rooms were clean breakfasts were self service buffet style and pretty good to be honest. I have no Gripes or complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Empire Palace”
Reviews.Author: cjmarkie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a quieter neighborhood not too far from the Republic Metro and just uphill from many of the major sites. In general the hotel is of a very high standard and a solid 4 star. The rooms are well furnished, reasonably sized for a major european city and I think very reasonably priced. The bathroom features good quality toiletries and in our case, bathrobes. We were upgraded to a junior suite so we also had a whirlpool tub and and extra dressing area/sitting area which was more than adequate for anyone planning an extended stay ( we were there 6 nights). The A/C worked well on what were very hot Roman Days ( typically about 90 and sunny in the first week of September 2011). Breakfast includes bacon, eggs, cheeses, fruits, breads and pastries an assortment of juices and whatever coffee/tea you like. It impressed me that even at the busiest times they always had a nice table ready and the various items were kept replenished. The woman who oversees the operation knows what she is doing. The front desk manager Silvano and his staff were very helpful and were nice to chat with they seemed to know about anything we asked and were correct in the information they supplied. Finally, there are by my count 6 restaurants and an Enoteca within a block or two of the hotel. Despite the quiet location off Via XX September these were plenty of good options particularly if you didn't want to go out too far after a heavy day of touring. We tried 3 of those restaurants ( out of a total of 6 nights to show you what we thought of them) and had very good meals at all of them. We also stopped for a glass of wine late one night on the way back to the hotel and found that Enoteca to be very knowledgeable about wine choices as well as having a good selection of salumis etc in case you wanted to just have dinner there. The hotel also has a very nice courtyard where you can have a drink anytime. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation and say it will be my first choice when I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in nice area”
Reviews.Author: Ro8erto
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in other reviews the rooms are not massive but also they are not that small.Our room was immaculate and we were also very grateful for the air conditioning. Lots of nice local restaurants, we ate at "Henry Cow",dont be put off by the strange name, it was excellent. Didnt eat in the hotel restaurant apart from breakfast which was very good.The neighbourhood is quiet and feels safe to walk around at all times.If you dont mind a bit of a walk this is a good location for all the main attractions of Rome and also only 10/15 mins walk from the Termini station. I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but surely will not return”
Reviews.Author: g0lf_vacati0ns
Reviews.Content: Ok, this hotel's location is good...within walking distance to many of Rome's attractions but I will not return. Rooms were very very very small. We had 2 luggages and had only space to put 1. I'm not kidding when i say the room was small. It really was SmallL....for over 200euro i was expecting better. Bed was comfortable, toilet very small.....shower area so small I kept hitting myself while showering (I'm a small asian!) Toothbrush not provided...when I approached the frontdesk they said they ran out of toothbrush! TV so small....it was like a TV and computer 2 in 1 kinda thing On the last day we had a guest entered our room....good thing I was not naked! Front desk said it was a 'mix up'! Will not return

Reviews.Title: “Clean, elegant and good service”
Reviews.Author: mAri40520
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a walking distance from all the Rome´s attractions (500-2000m). Rooms are quite small but nicely decorated. Service at the reception is excellent. The breakfast was very good, but don´t eat at the hotel´s own restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: lorilimelight
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and we had a suite which was very comfortable but had oversized furniture. The breakfast was served beautifully in a lovely room and food excellent. One problem was the lobby had many different levels with a few steps here and there so one had to be careful while walking around. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Glenn G
Reviews.Content: Picked up from the airport by the Hotel. Drive wen't 150 kilometers per hour driving us while honking his horn the whole way. Rooms are really dated and they us bed spreads, who uses those these days? Old is just not cutting it! This hotel is really dated and the staff act as if you are putting them out. Need to stay away from this place!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price and excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Aristotles
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Empire Palace in August for a 3 day weekend getaway for myself. I must say that the service at this hotel was outstanding by staff and room service. The Hotel location is quit excellent, though Rome small for tourists as most atractions are close by. It's a quick 15 minute walk to Fontana di Trevi, an additional 10 minutes to the Victor Emmanuel Monument and a further 15 minutes to the Coloseum. Though it will definitely be longer once you lose your self in the vast variety of designer stores. If you intend on visiting the Vatican, make sure you take a taxi! Rooms are small but cosy. You will find all amenities available, Minibar, Internet, PayTV, Safe, Air Conditioned, Clothes cupboard. It's a great stay, Rooms are modern and fantastic pricing!

Reviews.Title: “Had a lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Presto2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 days as part of a pre cruise package with Celebrity Cruises. We were not disappointed and thanks to previous reviews there were no surprises! The hotel is about a 2 mile walk from the Forum and 2 - 3 from the Vatican. It sounds a lot but when you are walking through Rome it is so wonderful that you never notice how far you have gone. It felt very safe and we had a great 2 days site seeing. The bedroom was very tiny - as shown in other photos on this site - but spotlessly clean, had good air con, was well maintained, decorated to a high standard and had lots of character. The bathroom was excellent and had everything we needed. We had 2 good nights sleep - thank you. There was also a turn down service which was a nice touch. The buffet breakfast was served in the beautiful dining room and there was a lovely courtyard where you could have a meal or a drink. We didn't eat in the hotel but found a nice Pizzeria not far from the hotel (thanks to previous reviews) called Henry Cow ! Don't be put off by the name, the food was excellent and on both evenings we had a very large, traditional pizza each, a bottle of very nice wine and desserts for about 45 euros. If you turn left as you leave the hotel and then first left the restaurant is about 200 yds up the street. There are also lots of little shops if you need to buy bottled water etc The staff at the hotel were very pleasant which made our stay even more enjoyable and we would like to thank them for giving us a great 2 day break before our cruise. We recommend this hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it”
Reviews.Author: AnnaG65
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Nice clean rooms. Friendly staff. Safe area. Walking distance to Metro station, Piaza Spagnia, Fontana di Trevi, restaurants, etc. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “They are better choices, but there are worse choices as well”
Reviews.Author: Enjoys_Relaxing
Reviews.Content: First of all, I must disclose that I only spent 120 Euros a night at this hotel, so for Rome this is dirt cheap. So to be fair, I must look at this establishment as a 120 Euros a night hotel. From that standpoint, it is only a 10-15 minute walk from the nearest metro station. There is not much going on in this area of Rome, but if you can get to a metro station, you can go some place else more happening. I even managed to walk to Roma Termini without much difficulty (except for trying to dodge traffic that seems to come at me with a vengeance). It is quiet, it is tucked away from the main crossroads. It has a restaurant that serves more than adequate dinner items. The dinner waitstaff is quite obliging. On the other hand, the room is small, the furniture worn out and dated, the ceiling paint peeling off in big pieces. The breakfast room can also get overcrowded in the morning, and the waitresses often are absent minded (one morning a waitress kept insisting giving me coffee instead of tea; and on another morning, another waitress cleared the table completely for the next guest while I was waiting in the buffet line). Depending on the time of day, the reception desk can be staffed with folks that either were curt (but delivers the information you were asking for), or great to work with. Cris in particular was very helpful. By the way, do not ask the front desk to break bills down, they always claim they do not have enough change (they don't even have change to break a 10 Euro bill down). This is not the Spanish steps, this is not the Roman colisseum. The neighborhood definitely doesn't compare to the more fancy ones in town, with the shopping and the dining. However, if the hotel price is right, and you are looking for a clean room with a decent bed, then one can always find the Roman Experience a subway ride away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Dizzy79
Reviews.Content: In a quiet yet central location, 10 minutes walk up the hill from Piazza Barberini, and about 10 minutes walk from Termini station. The hotel is in a beautiful old palazzo and has a delightful courtyard, as well as a nice bar and lounge area. The room itself was small -- we could barely avoid tripping over our big suitcase -- but appointed to the standard you would expect for 4 stars. Continental breakfast was fine, and reception staff were helpful. Make sure to try the fantastic gelateria 'I Caruso' about three blocks to the north.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience - wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: pmaninro
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through the "Small Luxury Hotels" website for a weekend trip to Rome. The price of the room was on the high end of what we wanted to spend, but we wanted an enjoyable weekend for the family. The hotel was tucked away in a quiet area of town (at least on the weekend). I wouldn't call this a luxury hotel whatsoever. I have stayed in luxury hotels before, which should mean excellent and courteous service and nice rooms. Maybe it was because we were Americans or because we had two small children with us, but the front desk staff was rude and unhelpful for the most part. We accidently left our nice SLR camera in a cab, but had the name of the taxi company and the taxi #, and we felt the hotel, which called the cab for us in the first place didn't do a whole lot to help us try and get the camera back (didn’t put a sense of urgency on the issue). The first floor (lobby/bar area) of the hotel was nice, but the rooms were dated and not well maintained. We came back to our room in the early afternoon on Saturday for a break from the heat, and it still had not been cleaned. If we ever go back to Rome, we will stick with an American branded hotel that we can trust.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: justcruising52
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our 3 day stay, the room was small but adequate for my wife and I. Staff friendly and always helpful, room service fine as was the breakfast. Would recommend this hotel to friends. Only compliant is that the use of a plastic under sheet makes for a somewhat uncomfortable sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: wycliff_travel
Reviews.Content: We had some confusion in the checkin process and the hotel staff didn't work with us to resolve the problem. In fact at points I felt they were a bit obnixious and didn't show an interest in trying to help. As a result, I'm afraid we can't relate with the pleasant experience others had, paricularly for this price. The location was nice, which put us within walking distance to the train station and some other Rome sites. It's a long walk walk to several other attractions, such as the Spanish steps and Trevi fountain. Overall I would not recommend this hotel. We had a great experience with another hotel in Rome with better location and a lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Good base from A trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: andrewb113
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights.Great location quiet with nice resteraunts near by.Try Piccolono abruzzo on Via silica 12courses for 38 euro. Think of it as a good 3 star plus not what I would call 4 star. Good breakfast clean but small rooms and a feeling of the 1990,s. Internet is very poor and charged at 5euro,s per night.We complained and it was waived. However I would stay again if the rate was competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, but a few minor issues”
Reviews.Author: Steffen P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Empire Palace hotel in mid May on our 10 year wedding anniversary. Overall, the hotel is very nice, but there are a few issues worth pointing out. On the positive side, we checked in and as SLH Club members, we had been upgraded to a Junior Suite. The room was fairly spacious, we got a bottle of Rose Prosecco and fresh fruit as a welcome. Very nice touch. Bed was fine, and so were the furnishings. The location of the hotel is absolutely fantastic. My wife and I are ardent walkers, so for us, there was no need to take a taxi anywhere as all the sights in Rome were walkable for us, including the Vatican. Breakfast is good, but not spectacular, and the bar has fair prices by Roman standards. The employee who checked us in was very friendly, and the doorman assisted my wife without having to be prompted. The hotel is also nice and quiet, so getting good sleep is easy. The minor issues are that the helpfulness and friendliness of employees hinges greatly on the individual employees. Some were terrific others were not very helpful and at times slightly stand-offish. Maybe the greatest issue we had was that the bathroom has a significant amount of mold around the caulking of the bathtub, and the front panel of the bathtub was so loose that it fell off on a couple of occasions when I accidentally touched it with the used towels on the floor. Overall, I would still recommend this hotel, but fixing the bathrooms and attitudes of some employees would go a long way to improving the quality of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Get Away From Tourist Bustle”
Reviews.Author: BLT310
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by our corporate travel advisor. I took a week in Rome after 3 weeks in Saudi Arabia, Egypt and Ethiopia on business. I did not want to be in a tourist trap and so our agent suggested the Empire Palace. It was perfect for my taste. It's in the business district but close to the Metro (6 min walk), U.S. Embassy (4 min), and banking. The hotel only has 113 rooms and caters to business people. Quite. Adequate fitness room (but Rome is a walking city so fitness by walking is typical). Local eateries abound. Two very good restaurants around the corner are moderately priced, but excellent in service, atmosphere, and quality. A small grocery is also in the same block for fruit and snacks. Coffee "bars" with pastry etc. are also nearby. I found the hotel exactly to my liking. My single room was small but comfortable and immaculate. The stall shower was small and would be difficult for a "large" person. The shower door provides no more than 20 inches width. Free internet, cable TV. Storage for clothing is almost non-existent. One small closet was there. I lived out of my suitcase which was stored under the window. I would definitley stay there again if I were return.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet luxury near the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: aMissElaineous
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were fortunate to stay at this hotel for ten days (1-11 March) as part of our honeymoon. It may not be a traditional “romantic” hotel (as one of the reviewers below mention, it is more of a business hotel), but it worked really well for us. The location is not central – and we certainly did a lot of walking during our time in Rome – but it is quiet. We had a courtyard room, so no traffic noise whatsoever, and the neighbourhood itself (between the US and UK embassies) seemed very calm and safe. There was not the constant traffic as seen in some of the more hotel-dense locations. The included breakfast became something we looked forward to each morning, and was perfect for stocking up before all that walking. There was an enormous selection: fresh fruit, pastries, cereal, bacon and eggs, toast, cold cuts, rolls . . . I could go on. Fresh fruit juice, as well as tea and coffee, were also on offer. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and spoke excellent English. The rooms were always cleaned to a high standard when we were out during the day – including chocolates on the pillow. The room itself was very nice. Described as a “junior suite” at the front desk, it consisted of a small anteroom with wardrobe, desk and TV, then a larger bedroom (also with TV) and a decent-sized bathroom. An expected bonus was that the bathtub was also a Jacuzzi (with six jets), and it was wonderful to soak in the evenings after all the walking. Robes and slippers were also provided. I feel a bit picky discussing the negatives, but here it goes . . . the number of light switches in the room was a bit overwhelming for a small space. I think there were at least 12 switches, not all in the room they worked with, e.g. one bathroom light had to be turned on in the bathroom, the other was located in the bedroom. After ten days there we certainly had a fair idea of what was what, but for the first few it was a matter of trial and error. It was rather cold when we were in Rome, and it was nice to see that they had extra blankets in the wardrobe. However, when used, the blankets “shed” horribly. I grew up with three cats and a dog, and the blankets got more hair on our clothes than the pets ever did. Finally, as discussed in a review below, the pillows and mattress were rather hard, or at least harder than I am used to.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in Italy”
Reviews.Author: lkwammack
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not in the city center, but my three girlfriends and I enjoyed it immensely. The rooms were very nice, the staff helpful, expecially Pedro the doorman, and the breakfast was fabulous. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel, away from the hustle and bustle.”
Reviews.Author: MarkShendishManor
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in the business area, which means clean, quiet and safe streets. 10-15 minute walk to the fountain and steps. Nice couple of restaurants round the corner from the hotel. (Turn left, and left again) Got upgraded to a superior room, can only imagined what the one we had booked was like. Room was small, shower leaky and bath old. Twin beds instead of a double, but didnt complain in case they put us back into our original room which on paper would of been a downgrade. Rome grows on you the longer you are there, although very expensive. The record for the weekend was a 9 euro beer. This hotel is okay if you dont mind the walk and you havent paid too much for it. It cost us £865 for two flights from London and 3 nights in the Hotel. Hope this info helps you with your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, delicous breakfast, good location for business.”
Reviews.Author: k12317
Reviews.Content: The staff at Empire Palace are just lovely, always so friendly and willing to help with was one of the stand out features of the hotel. Located in more of the business district with many Embassy's nearby, its a 20 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain, while easy to get around if you want to be in the heart of the tourist area this hotel probably isn't the best option. The rooms are nicely decorated in an old regal Roman style rather than modern. The beds are nice and big but the hotel could do with replacing their pillows because they are a bit hard and lumpy. The room is carpeted and has good heating which makes it nice and cozy in winter. The breakfast was the best we've had in Italy. Great Cappucinos, fresh fruit, freshly baked cakes and a huge range of other items. Breakfast is early 6.30am which is great for those travelling like us with a young child who wakes up early. Most hotels don't start breakfast until 7.30am onwards. There are a number of restaurants just steps away from the hotel. A fantastic wood fire pizza joint across the road 50m down, a lovely wine bar on the corner and a delicious alimentari (supermarket/fresh food store) that serves up pizza, veg dishes, cheese and meats all day, we ate here every day. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel with good location.”
Reviews.Author: AlmightyEvil
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights for my girlfriends birthday. A really nice hotel with great service and friendly and helpful staff. The room was medium size, clean and quiet. The restaurant was really nice with great service and good value. We got a bottle of free champange on the day of my girlfriends birthday. The location is good. Not in the middle of everything but still in walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a convenient and quiet location.”
Reviews.Author: Lambert99
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights here for a short break holiday. The hotel was much better than I expected. The restaurant was really delightful. The food was excellent and the wine list had a good selection of Italian wines. The service was impeccable. The rooms were on the small side and the air conditioning wasn't working at this time of year so I found it a little warm at night, but luckily my window overlooked the courtyard which was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: hotelinspectorHerts
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly well located hotel. We walked around Rome for two days, no need for metro! We asked for a quiet room away from the road and were not disappointed. The hotel is positioned about 10minutes away from via veneto where many restraunts are found for an evening meal. The hotel bar was also useful for a night cap open until midnight. A very enjoyable stay. Recommend an airport transfer as Rome taxi driver on return to airport tried to rip us off.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jaydubbleyou
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Empire Palace for 5 days last month. Location wise it was about a 20 minute walk into the centre of Rome, which was fine once we got our bearings! The room was clean and comfy although the bed was a little hard and we both woke with back pain each day. The staff were really friendly and helpful and at times went out of their way to accommodate us. The bar was nice, the breakfast filling, although not that exciting. Generally a nice place! I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “FAVOLOSA / FABULOUS!!!”
Reviews.Author: SNH1301
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my boyfriend for three nights in January. I am a member of Small Luxury Hotels of the World and we were upgraded to a suite on arrival. The room was lovely (room 105), bathroom fab (Etro shower gels etc) ... Service was brilliant and our overall stay was just wonderful! We got the bus to the spanish steps ... but we could have walked easily 20 mins ... We ate in the hotel on our first night and it was lovely. we were treated so well by the waiters and I don't even eat much bread but the bread basket contained the most amazing bread i have ever eaten & they filled it up & up... We were recommended to try Taverna Flavia which is a one minute walk from the hotel on our next night by the really helpful chap at reception - please go to this restaurant - such character and Mr Mimmo sits at a table by the door and welcomes you ... food fabulous also! Also Harry's bar is a must ! It's rather expensive but well worth it! Just a great trip to Rome and will most defo be heading back to the hotel - absolutely no complaints (and i'm v fussy!!) 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasurable stay”
Reviews.Author: MikeR2011
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well kept. Luxury abounds. The room is stunning. Bathroom really pretty. Could have softer pillows. But that is my only complaint. Breakfast included was very good. Internet was a charge, but we got wireless from somewhere on second floor for free! A little bit of a walk to republica metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, be prepared to walk!”
Reviews.Author: mandor58
Reviews.Content: This hotel was suggested by our travel agent and based on the reviews here we went with it. It is a small elegant hotel on the corner of some fairly quiet side streets. It reminded us of downtown Manhattan with the cobblestone streets and all. It is not a tourist hotel, mostly business people so it's pretty quiet inside and no one bothers you. The bed was comfortable and I really liked the quality of the bathroom toiletries provided. Nice shower/tub. Minifridge also but we might have been upgraded. You have to insert your key into a slot in the room to turn the room on otherwise the lights won't function. This way when you leave you have to take your key and can't waste power. Pretty neat! Since it is not tourist-y it is not as close to the Colisseum, Trevi Fountain, or the Spanish steps. It is walkable but from other accounts it would be a decent 20-30 minute walk. We walked about 10-15 minutes to the Metro station and used that to get around. For 1 euro it was worth it. From the hotel's description we felt the Metro was a little further than described. We used it to to get to Vatican City (a stop past the Spanish Steps) and the Coliseum and it was easy. We felt safe and there is good signage. We walked from the hotel to Piazza Barberini and Via Veneto and saw the Capuchin Crypt (1 euro donation, for entry, pretty creepy and cool BTW) On the same square block as the hotel and on the side streets are several great little restaurants and a wine shop. The hotel breakfast was really good - hot eggs, sausage, bacon, cheese, meat, fruit, yogurt, juice, etc. Ours was included in the package, really nice. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant except for room service one day and it was good. The bad - I said it reminded me of a side street in downtown Manhattan. Relatively quiet yes, but the hotel only has shutters on the windows - no glass. In the morning you hear EVERYTHING - cars and scooters going over cobblestones, church bells, garbage trucks. We probably would have slept through it except being from NY their 6am was our midnight so we were just starting to get into some really good sleep. They also charge something absurd like 12 euros/day for the internet and TV as a bundle (I think - we never used the TV, travel with a laptop and shows/movies.) The internet stopped working for about 12 hours. I complained to the front desk and they removed the charge for that day and the following day also, even though it was working by then.

Reviews.Title: “A good surprise!”
Reviews.Author: romeriboell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Empire Palace for 3 nights. It was really a good surprise! The hotel was nicer than I thought. It was nice, quiet and clean and the staff very helpful. The room was large and comfortable, the bathroom had a shower and it was very clean. We really appreciated the robes and slippers. Breakfast was buffet style offering a varied range of juices, cereal, bread, cheese, cold meats and scrambled eggs. The hotel is a short walk from the piazza barberini where you can find the subway and at Via Flavia near the hotel there are good restaurants and wine bars. I really liked the hotel and I think it was a great experience in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bioko
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights on a business trip. The stuff was always very friendly. My room was excellent, with a very nice well equipped bathroom. The breakfast is great, with a very nice buffet and excellent and fast staff as well. The hotel lies within a 20min walk to the center. You get to Piazza Barberini in a 5-10 Min walk. Only drawback: no free internet. For the price you pay, I think this should be standard.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, excellent room, friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Harriett10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Empire Palace for 3 nights. The hotel was very clean, all staff very helpful. The room was large with a bath and shower ensuite. Robes and slippers provided. Breakfast was buffet style offering a varied range of juices, cereal, muesli, bread and cold meats. Hot bacon and scrambled eggs were also on offer. The hotel is a short walk from the piazza barberina where there is a vast range of restaurants and pizza places. There is a particularly good restaurant off the piazza on the via veneto called CIAO BELLA. The food and service is excellent. From this piazza there is easy access to all the main attractions. It is worthy of note that if the Vatican Museum is an intended stop during your stay log on to the Vatican Museums and book your tickets on line this avoids all queues which were particularly lengthy during our stay. Just print the voucher and show to customer service staff and the queue is avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel less than 20 minutes walk from center”
Reviews.Author: ajt4
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very decent for the price. Our room was actually a decent size with plenty of room to walk around the bed. We faced the inner courtyard and it was very quiet. Also extremely dark when curtains are closed. The beds are hard, as are the pillows. I knew we could get other pillows but never bothered. Breakfast is okay and nice that it's included in the room. I did use the internet and bought the tv option with it. We watched several movies that night. My only complaint is the volume was lower on the movies. Not a horrible issue but somewhat annoying. Rooms are clean - housekeeping is great. You can walk down to the bar and get a bucket of ice. The big worry I had was restaurants near the hotel. We had great luck. If you walk left out of the hotel - at the end of the street is a wine bar. Fantastic bruschetta, prosciutto, cheese. There is another restaurant kitty-corner to the wine bar and we had lunch there one day. I had an amazing shrimp, squash-blossom risotto. There is also a great Gelato place - go out the hotel, turn left, go to end of street and go left. Walk 2-3 blocks and turn left. It's half way down on the left. The hotel is in a business area - which some may not like. I thought it was great as it was quiet and not full of tourists. Most of the restaurants seemed to be full of locals or those from the hotel. I would stay here again as it was very simple to take the subway or walk to where you want to go.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant hotel. This hotel is away...”
Reviews.Author: Scottyoats
Reviews.Content: A brilliant hotel. This hotel is away from the hussel of the main attractions, but within easy reach of all main attractions. The breakfast is perfect to set you up for the day. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Fitness room, my husband found adequate. Some lovely places to eat in next street from hotel, with good prices. As restaurants near attractions can be pricy. Will stay there again as very good value for money. A holiday to remember in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Small Luxury Hotel Group Another Classic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShaunScotland
Reviews.Content: 440 Euros for 4 nights B+B for 2 people in the city centre of Rome in the middle of the summer holidays. I does not get any better. Fantastic place very stylish, and quiet with helpful staff. We had a room on the 4th floor over looking the central courtyard so no noise and nice and dark once the curtains were closed. The room was on the smallish side for my liking as you just had enough room to walk around the bed and not much more. The bathroom was smallish as well and I did find the shower cabinet very tight. But then again the buiding has been converted so they just made the best use of what space they had. They charged you 19 euros for your internet connection for 24hrs and for that it also gave you all the TV and Film channels as well. We loved this hotel for the closeness to all the sites of Rome plus the ease of access to the cafes and bars. Breakfast was well stocked with both hot and cold dishes. There was no parking at the hotel but they arranged under ground secure parking near by for 25 euros a day. We used Varstours as recommended by the hotel as they were based just around the corner, their service could be a bit of hit or a miss depending on guide but they did get you past all the large queues. A few good cafes around the hotel but we found one just right and right once you step out of the front door very good pizza and snacks at a very good price plus he does like a good chat very entertaining. Any way loved this hotel and can not wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: mols0n
Reviews.Content: We got a fantastic deal through hotwire and this hotel was a great place for the location, spaciousness, and cleanliness. The stay was following a cruise and we were ill due to the flu and the hotel allowed us to recover with 12 hrs and gave us a chance to explore Rome on a tight schedule. There's also a great little wine bar and the breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend- friendly hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: Aspin02
Reviews.Content: I visited Rome with my husband and another couple. We found staff were very helpful and friendly at this hotel, always available day and night. Breakfast was good with hot bacon and scrambled egg, as well as usual continental breakfast every morning, which is a definite plus in Europe. The location was central for all attractions, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and Colleseum all approx 15 - 20 mins walk. Tour bus a great option to visit Vatican. Top tip- well worth booking Vatican tour and Colleseum in advance to skip the line as you can wait an hour to enter. The hotel has a restaurant and there are 3 very nice restaurants and a wine bar just around the corner, so no need to go far after a busy day. Staff were local and could recommend tours, taxis, places to eat and give directions. Would certainly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico”
Reviews.Author: KazNewcastle
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel because of the good trip advisor ratings, we were not dissappointed. We were celebrating our 12th wedding anniversary and were very kindly upgraded to a suite, it was a fantastic surprise and very generous gesture on behalf of the hotel and made our stay more memorable. The hotel is situated in a quiet area of Rome, although Via Veneto and Via Borghese is a short walk away. The suite we were given had it's own small living area, large bedroom with a super king size bed and large bathroom with shower, the toiletries are gorgeous. The rooms are spotless, have great airconditioning, mini bar and snacks and good quality bathrobes and slippers are provided. In the evening when you are out a maid comes in and changes the towels, provides more toiletries and turns the bed down. The breakfasts are lovely, scrambled egg, bacon, sausage as well as the usual cold meats, cheeses, fruit, yoghurt and toast. The bar is not that much more expensive than anywhere else in the Rome and there is a very nice court yard area with a fountain. There are a few restaurants in the area surrounding the hotel but it's very quiet and doesn't have the holiday atmosphere we were looking for so for the last two nights were were there we caught a taxi to the Pantheon were there were lots of little restaurants is a lovely square and lots of atmosphere. Via Veneto is very nice but expensive there are exclusive shops and restaurants including Cafe De Paris, Hard Rock Cafe and Harry's Bar. The Via Borghese park is not far from here and we spent a lovely afternoon there on Sunday driving through it in a golf buggy we hired for 40 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: steve75oz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel based on the positive feedback left by other contributors. I was not disappointed in the slightest. About a 10 minute walk from the main train station, the hotel is situated off the noisy streets in what appeared to be a business / trendy area. The hotel was in easy walking distance to many of Rome's attractions, cafes and restaurants. I walked absolutely everywhere, didn't catch the train or bus in the 4 nights I was there however I am a keen walker. The room's are very well furnished with plush finishings, the rooms are standard size for Europe - if you come from the US you'll think they are small but its pretty standard. I travel the world with my job, with lots of high spec hotels and although this was a vacation I would definitely stay here again. Don't miss out of the breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again, good points overshadowed negative...”
Reviews.Author: Welshgirlonholidays
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights with my other half from 16th-19th Aug. We took a taxi from Ciampino airport (40 euros) but I belive the hotel was easily accessible from the Termini bus station. Location wise, the hotel was in a quiet area which seemed to be residential ish / businesses etc. I would say that for a 4 star, I was not blown away, but the hotel was nice enough that I would recommend to others overall. Positives: Hotel staff helpful and friendly Hotel rooms clean and cleaners changed towels, made beds daily Hotel bathroom very spacious Shower excellent! Breakfast fine Negative Bedroom area VERY small, only enough room to literally walk around the bed Location ok for most, but not if infirm, unfit or pregnant (as I was) due to the 20 min walk to Spanish steps etc involving walking up numerous hills Pillows very lumpy (Tip: Do not eat at the restaurant recommended by the hotel - Taverna Flavia (down the street and on the right), although the food is ok it is VERY overpriced!! We paid 60 euro for a small lasagna, a beef steak, some chips and water!!!) You will get nicer food at a more reasonable price if you walk into the main tourist area of Rome. I would also add, if you book any of the trips as we did, Rome in a day, be prepared that this trip involves HOURS of non stop walking. Although you see some fantastic sights (Vatican, Sistine Chapel etc) I would not recommend this trip to anyone with any problems walking as there are VERY FEW opportunities to rest. Also, as a pregnant tourist I found Rome to be very poor overall in terms of public toilets... Overall, this hotel provided a good base for exploring Rome, we would return and I'm sure I could negotiate the walk into the main areas far better were I not pregnant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Worth the $$$”
Reviews.Author: parvati7
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel to come back to after sightseeing and shopping. I had reserved a single room and the bed was still a good size (double), with soft comfy sheets and covers. My room was on the inside, overlooking the inner courtyard (bar) below and was very quiet. Everything super clean. The large bathroom, with its powerful showerhead and hot water, was a treat. Likewise, the room had powerful a/c - I actually had to turn it off at one point. The room had a tv monitor (for Internet), a well-stocked minibar and a safe. The first day that I arrived, the manager at the desk pulled out a map and circled the places that I wished to visit. Also, the front desk ordered me a taxi the night before to take me to the airport (50 euro, by the way), and the hotel was in close proximity (via taxi) to Termini train station. In the a.m., there is a wonderful breakfast buffet downstairs, in the restaurant. Don't get fresh squeezed o.j., though. 7 euro and more water than juice. It's true about the sites. They are at least a 15 min.-20 min. walk. Luckily, taxis are everywhere and cheap enough to bounce from one place to the next. There were about 3 restaurants around the corner from the hotel, if you don't feel like eating in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - fab beds and very boutique feeling”
Reviews.Author: MissJA616
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in Rome. Modern updates and flower fragrance throughout was refreshing. Beds were the most comfortable on our trip - order the soft pillows to make it even more comfortable. We had one room on the street-side (a little noisy with carts being pushed down cobble stones VERY early in the morning) and one courtyard side (VERY quiet). Staff was very responsive and the breakfast was excellent with many choices so we didn't tire of the options in the 4 mornings we ate there. I wish they would have free wifi for these prices and each computer (smart phone) requires it's own 11 euro / 24 hour access code. But, this was our saving grace. The first hotel our travel agent had booked was a dump and the Empire took a 'day-of' reservation on a Roman holiday and salvaged our trip to Rome. Amazingly great hotel. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel with Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: miketp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here pre-cruise. It is in a quiet area near government buildings and embassies. It is about a 10-15 minute walk to the Spanish Steps and about 2 blocks from the VasTours bus terminal which made it very convenient for the tours we were taking. The rooms were spacious and clean, as was the bathroom. Shower had plenty of water pressure and hot water which was a pleasant surprise. We hardly heard any other guests and bed was very comfortable. The bar had a nice selection and provided free olives and snacks with drink. We ate in the hotel restaurant one night and the service was friendly and accommodating. My wife did not see anything she wanted on the menu and the waiter offered to get her spaghetti bolognese which she enjoyed. I had the braised rabbbit which was excellent. the front desk staff were friendly and helpful when we needed directions. We were very happy with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Clean, Quiet, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: JG313
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this hotel. After hearing horror stories about international hotels, we were pleasantly pleased with our selection. The room and the bathroom were large. The towels were plush and they even provided terry cloth robes and slippers. The bed was large and very comfortable. The hotel was in an excellent location and very quiet. I slept like a baby, which is very uncommon for me when I am traveling. The complimentary breakfasts were delightful, delicious, and served very nicely in the restaurant on tables with linens and china. Couldn't ask for much more than this. Close to Hop On/Hop Off buses, train station, taxis. Will definitely stay here again when I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel away from tourist crowds”
Reviews.Author: Hermine5
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in this hotel and had a wonderful experience. The location is central but away from the main touristy areas. The staff is very friendly, professional and gave great recommendations for restaurants. The room was excellent for a city break - not too big but not too small either, beautifully furnished, with extra large king size bed. Bathroom was all marble with perfect shower and delicious toiletries. Breakfast is varied with a choice of hot and cold buffet and the best coffee in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience - I dont think you can mess up by staying here”
Reviews.Author: ssimon1999
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a funky, boutique-type hotel within the center of Rome. However, while you are able to navigate through Rome from this location, it is not exactly positioned where the action is....ie spanish steps, forum area, etc. The main metro station is about a 10 min walk, so if you have kids or elderly people it could be a problem if you plan to get around Rome by metro/foot. Getting back and forth by taxi was not a problem and was quite reasonable. The rooms were clean, average sized (especially by European standards) and the staff was very nice. The breakfast that is offered was VERY good...more than the typical continental breakfast...they had eggs, bacon and other hot foods....well worth it. The staff was very accomodating in helping us get to where we needed to be and go and in whatever we needed. The value of the hotel was very good compared to others more centrally located. They had internet access in the rooms and had a computer in the lobby area that one can use.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: lolabagins
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights in the Empire Palace Hotel. The room, albeit small, had everything you could need. The bed was really comfortable. Smashing pillows! The bathroom was quite large for a city hotel. The room was exceptionally clean. Complimentary breakfast was good in a nice restaurant. The staff was wonderful and so helpful. We felt completely relaxed and happy for the entire stay. It is a little bit out of the way but for a 20 minute walk into the attractions is well worth it to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Near The Centre”
Reviews.Author: dhz_tlv
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Rome, my mother, my teen-aged nephew and me. We spent some time with the travel agent to search for the right hotel. The hotels he suggested were not given very good reviews in Trip Advisor, and I didn't want our vacation to be hindered by a problematic hotel. We booked two rooms, which made it more difficult to find a good hotel. When the travel agent suggested the Empire Palace hotel, on wich I read good reviews, we jumped at the opportunity and booked it. I do not regret this decision. The hotel is located a few minutes walk from Pizza Della Repubblica (and from the central train station) from which it is easy to get transportation to wherever you want to go. It is also possible to reach many parts of Rome on foot (e.g.: the Fontana Di Trevi is not far away). It is quiet at night, and we were able to sleep well. The rooms are of reasonable size, modern and kept clean. The breakfast buffet was very good, and lats but not least, the staff was courteous and helpful. I will definitely consider booking this hotel for my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “True four star hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: PAMomanddaughter
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the Empire, wouldn't actually have picked it I guess, but my husband had a meeting there and the reviews sounded pretty good, and the price was definitely right (we did pay for all but two nights so that was definitely true). If I'd had to do it myself, I might have picked a different location, maybe a little more central, but actually it was pretty good and close to a lot. We didn't get to a few things that we could have gone to by metro or bus as we preferred to walk everywhere our first time in Rome, but that would have been easy to do from that location. And, it was near a lot of good stuff and some good restaurants. Plus, quiet for sleeping. The rooms were big for a EU hotel, beds quite comfy. Except the pillows could be better, they are a little hard but not terrible. The rooms were spotless and the service was superb. Fairly big bathroom, typical EU shower with a small glass door on a bath, but functioned quite well and mostly the bathroom didn't get wet. Shower pressure was great and the soap and products provided were great, also with a heated towel bar and two comfy robes and slippers. Internet wasn't too bad, have had worse and had both cable and some wifi in the room. Breakfast came with the room rate so the value was really good as it was a huge buffet with excellent food. We ended up eating a really big breakfast and then only drinking water during the day, maybe a really small snack and going for an early dinner (that's not so easy in Rome) but pizzerias always open and since it's very close to Piazza Barberini there are tons of restaurants open early there (not only pizzerias). Had some excellent food there and also on Via de Piave. Our furthest walk was to the Vatican, 2 miles to the museum entrance. Colosseum was only about 1.5 miles, maybe a little less. We walked everywhere, lucked out with really good weather, even when the forecast said rain, it rarely even sprinkled. Hotel staff was very helpful and nice, suggested dinners. Also we thought we may have to stay an extra day due to weather in the US but didn't but they said no problem. Didn't look at the exercise room, I suspect not much in there, we just walked a LOT instead of working out. So location, maybe could be better, but next time I'd probably use the metro since I now know my way around, and in that case, you couldn't do much better, since it was near Termini so you could catch both lines there. Only watch out for the little (or not so little) gifts left by walking dogs. The sidewalks in the neighborhood don't seem to inspire people to clean after their pooches. Otherwise... couldn't be better, excellent value and really nice hotel. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, but website photos seem exaggerated”
Reviews.Author: Schroedinger
Reviews.Content: A decent hotel. The room I had was of ok standard, but very small. The nicest part was probably the bathroom, which was elegant and had an exquisite selection of amenities. I was altogether disappointed with this hotel though, from the website it seemed much nicer than it was. I was particularly disappointed with the "gym", which was ridiculously small. I haven't tried other Rome hotels, but I'd be surprised if there aren't better options at this price. Their internet/wifi solution was below par - which is very annoying when you plan to work off your room.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay though not ideally located”
Reviews.Author: agaurav
Reviews.Content: My wife, two kids (6 and 1) and I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. We went there from Boston, USA and this was our first trip to Europe. We had been warned about the small room sizes so we paid extra to get one of the larger ones so that we could use a crib for our toddler. The hotel was neat and clean. The bathrooms in Europe are supposed to be tiny but we had no issues at all. Very modern. No high speed internet which I wanted to figure out when are we going next. Wasn't exactly child-proof but then maybe people in the US are extra cautious etc. It is located a good distance from the nearest Metro train station so on a hot day with the kids we were in trouble and had to take a taxi. It is walkable but a good 20 min walk. There isn't a lot to see near the hotel, everything is a good 15-30 min walk so yes, there might be other hotels in Rome that are better situated. The buffet breakfast was pretty good. Lots of fruits, cheese, cold cereals, yogurt and other sweet stuff that we hated but my 6 year old loved. Some eggs and sausages too.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and great value”
Reviews.Author: travelfan725
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Empire Palace Hotel was truly a great experience. It is a quiet, elegant hotel, with luxurious furnishings on a quiet street. The rooms were a little small, but were furnished beautifully and felt like a welcome retreat from the hustle and bustle of Rome. The bathroom though was very large and well appointed. I've seen some reviewers complain about the location. I think these complaints are misplaced. It is only a five minute walk from a major square in Rome with all public transporation available - Piazza Barberini, and only a ten minute walk from the Spanish Steps. But it is off the beaten and well touristed busy streets, in an upscale residential neighborhood - a perfect location as far as I was concerned. The staff was friendly and helpful, and made excellent recommendations. Another highlight of the hotel was the free breakfast, a true breakfast feast, one of the best I've ever had in any hotel. For my 4 night stay in August 2009 the hotel was running an amazing internet special of 100 euro a night, a steal for this four star hotel. I strongly recommend the Hotel Empire Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: SMRivelli
Reviews.Content: My partner and I decided to stay a few days in Rome before we left on a 12 day cruise. The Empire Palace was recommended by a friend. We did our homework and check out the other hotels in the area and were impressed by the great reviews on Trip Advisor. We own a small Inn in Hollywood Florida, Ocean Inn Hollywood, and know firsthand how this review process works and ready every review. We were not disappointed. We arrived early which was not a problem since our room was ready, the staff was very friendly and spoke perfect English, They provided us with a map and suggestions and pointed us in the right direction every day. The room was clean nicely decorated and everything in good working order including the A/C. Breakfast was included each morning with a very generous buffet. Rome is really easy to get around and the hotel is in walking distance to everything. If you prefer the Metro is just a few short blocks away. Around the corner are 3 Cafes. We ate at 2 of the 3 and were very happy that we did. My Partner and I are well traveled and the owners of the Ocean Inn in Hollywood, Florida. We would recommend the Empire Palace to anyone looking to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Plain, overpriced, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: trueblueUSA
Reviews.Content: Service on front desk was poor. Rooms were small. Expensive. Location OK, ten minutes walk to anywhere great.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean, and spacious hotel in an OK location”
Reviews.Author: vhalili78
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within walking distance to Termini Station so you can easily get there from the airport. It's also a few minutes walk to the Republica Metro station. The location is great in terms of being close to the trains but not so great past 11:30 pm (which is when the metros stop running, til 12:30 Saturdays). You should probably learn the bus system which runs in more directions and travels later. It's a bit of a far walk, though when you want to go into the center of the city and to Trastevere but it's do-able. If you don't mind that, the hotel has pretty good service and it's very clean. The room is also big for a European hotel room and the hotel itself is in a quiet location. They have a computer in the room that you can use the internet but it's really slow (5 euros for 3 nights). You're better off going to an internet cafe. It's a good hotel but I probably would choose a different one in a different location if I ever go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Small and friendly hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Cathendo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a long weekend in Rome to watch Wales v Italy. I chose this hotel following favourable reviews and we were not disappointed. As has been mentioned, the rooms are small but this is not unusual for Rome. The bathroom had a small shower cubicle (no bath) which was OK and the toiletries provided were of a good standard. The bed was a little hard but we found the pillows were rock hard - my husband said it was like sleeping with your head on a brick!! As we were only there for a few days this was not too uncomfortable, but if we had been there longer we might have asked for something a bit softer. The reception staff were very helpful, as were the staff in the restaurant. We only ate breakfast in the hotel and there was plenty of variety - fruit, croissants, cooked, etc. The hotel is in a good location and just a short walk from the nearest Metro - Republica - and the bus terminus. You can get anywhere in Rome from here. There were lots of local restaurants within walking distance and we ate out every night. One evening we ate in an Argentinian restaurant called Baires which had the most fantastic steak. All in all, the Empire Palace is a small and friendly hotel in a convenient location. The rooms were kept immaculately clean and extra towels were provided daily. Bath robes and slippers were also provided. Drinks in the bar were expensive, but no more so than anywhere else in Rome. We would not hesitate to use this hotel again and look forward to visiting Rome again, probably in another two years.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel, attentive staff, good food”
Reviews.Author: zojanaha
Reviews.Content: We found the room very small and we looked out at a Harley Davidson showroom (although there are worse views!) and not a lot of light could enter the room. The bed was rather hard but the Egyptian cotton sheets added a touch of luxury. Nice bathroom and accessories. Friendly and helpful staff. Good food. The public areas are lovely, especially the bar. For our purposes we found the hotel too far away from main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Uhm...you can find better”
Reviews.Author: CicciCh
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly. The room was clean and very, very quiet. The breakfast was good. I didn't choose this hotel myself as somebody else booked this hotel for me. I was disappointed when I arrived at the hotel and the internet in my room didn't work. The staff promised to take care of the problem but they never did. Beside that, in a 4 stars hotel you should expect free internet at least in the lounge, but I had to pay for each connection. Anyway, it is not too far from the bus stop to visit the different area's in Rome. This hotel is okay but I won't go back next time. I stayed also in other hotels in Rome, cheaper, better and definetely more beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kentucky123
Reviews.Content: Large rooms for Europe hotels. Attractions not to far.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Anniversary Location”
Reviews.Author: KThewanderer
Reviews.Content: Brilliant, brilliant, brilliant, living up to every expectation. Extremely well organised hotel with friendly staff. Speedy check in to a cool air conditioned room. Though the room felt a little small we put this down to the 'king-sized' double. Both bedroom and bathroom were decorated to high standard and clean. The bed was turned down each evening and the air con on for our return from a fantastic sightseeing trips in 34 degree heat. Receptioist offered us immediate answers and advise on location of attractions. Bar was understandably pricey however the entertainment and humour afforded by the cocktail waiter was worth the expense, great service (hidden humour). Would strongly recommend this stay which is 15 minutes walk / 5 minutes taxi from central Termini Station. Close enough to all attractions and worth the walk to those further away, approx 10 minutes from Metro. Breakfast selection sufficiently filling to justify skipping lunch (I told my wife!). The Champagne at breakfast was a real coup. August is a quiet time in Rome, the locals go away from the city on holiday - great really to visit at this time as the service seems more personal. Local restaurants offer tasty menu's with no disappointments. Suggest you try out 'Babbo's' Pizzeria Steak & Fish Restaurant where the service was swift, food was tasty and "Sorbetto al limone" a lemon gin sorbet aftershock drink was amazing (see hint). Taxi's are cheap if the Rome hills are a little exhausting.

Reviews.Title: “What a clean hotel with a great Bar and WELCOME from the reception staff”
Reviews.Author: EnglandQuasar
Reviews.Content: 4 adults stayed for 4 nights and it was lovely. From the moment we arrived tired and hungry from our journey when the reception staff were first class and even gave us a big map and pointed out several interesting places and how to get to them from the hotel till check out at noon that was great and you use the luggage room if you wante to. The courtyard was cool and would be lovely in the burning heat of summer and had a calm feeling with a lovely water feature. The Blue Bar has lovely staff who remembered what you liked and always brought sweet and savoury bites without asking to nibble at. It was a very good place to sit after hours walking around the sights of Rome and after returning from one of the good eating establishments around the block. The place with the yellow sign was a fab place to eat and you had to book but it was worth it. Also the breakfast was lovely with good service and plenty of choice from egg and bacon to toast and rolls and jam and cheese and cold meats. Also pastries and croissants and cerel and juices etc. They brought tea and coffee to your table and always were smiling and organised and friendly without bothering you. The rooms were on the small side but plenty big enough and kept clean. I woutd implore you stay HERE when you are next in Rome and would do myself ........................

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: NeilAspinsFoot
Reviews.Content: Rome as a city is the perfect romantic get-a-way. The hotel was clean, well presented and a reasonable price. The room was a good size and comfortable and the service was amazingly friendly, informative and better than 90% of hotels I have stayed in previously. Breakfast was excellent also. It is only a 10 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain and there are some lovely restaurants and bars nearby. The Blue Bar at the hotel served beautiful wine, and the staff couldn't stop talking about Italian football in there!! The hotel really is a great location for a weekend away in Rome and provides everything you need, and possibly more than you would get for your money smack in the centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Dashkina
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, and we were having a conference in this hotel as well. Location is fine, but it is somewhat on the side of the downtown. If you are planning a vacation, I would suggest staying somewhere closer to Piazza Navona or Trevi fountain. Regarding accommodation, I think I had a standard room, which was very nicely furnished, but was very small. There was no designated place for the suitecase, so I had to sqeeze mine on the floor between the bed and the wall. Of course, it was not possible to walk there anymore, so to open the curtaines I had to crawl over the bed. The bathroom was also very small with a shower cabin. I am not very tall, so it was fine for me, but my husband could hardly fit in it. The staff in this hotel is another issue. There can be a bell-boy, in a while you will meet him as a technitian, and some time later he is a waitor. So, this was quite strange. I think overall, by Italian merits, the staff was ok. Breakfast was also fine, nothing special. Scrammbled eggs & sausages were the only hot meal. This was my first trip to Rome, and after work I took a 5-day vacation, and my husband and I rented a cozy apartment around the corner from the Pantheon 3 times cheaper than a standard room in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kolidakis
Reviews.Content: The empire palace hotel was wonderful. My family and I stayed there and it was clean and the breakfast was great!! The room was on the small side, but the bathroom was huge and very clean. It was a short walk to Piazza Barberini, and we would all definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality for Price”
Reviews.Author: purpleladyLeuven
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard room which was big enough for 2 and 2 small suitcases. The hotel is actually a lot smaller than it looks on the website. Positive: Rooms are small but comfortable and clean. Excellent beds. Quiet hotel. Great breakfast! Hotels is close to subway. A few restaurants nearby. Negative: nothing really except maybe that the rates are quite high and that they charged for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little place, close enough to everything, quiet”
Reviews.Author: fusiongal
Reviews.Content: It appears that most hotel reviews are a reflection of price versus expectation. With that in mind, we found this to be a lovely hotel, with a good price (we booked through Hotwire), and centrally located.
