It was more on the edge, than in the center of central Rome, but it was less than 10 minutes to the train station (city bus tours also start from the train station so that was helpful), and about 5-6 minutes to the closest Metro station. We did walk back from the Colosseum one evening, however, that took about 35-45 minutes. Quite doable if you enjoy walking, but a bit tiring if you've already spent the day sightseeing. (I'd suggest the metro for getting to the attractions - Colosseum, Vatican etc). The room we had was spacious enough, with about 3 feet of room between the foot of the bed, and the desk/TV. It had the amenities you would expect for a higher end hotel (but I have to admit we didn't use too many of them). As other reviews have stated - breakfast was good. Eggs, Sausage, pastries, juices, fruits. (some canned, some fresh) The room was clean and the almost all marble bathroom was warm and cosy with enough space (ie. functionally small, but not cramped). Since it was winter, the heated towel racks were nice (and also a useful place to quick dry some hand-washed laundry). The staff were very helpful, considerate, and had better english language skills than some other hotels we stayed at during our trip. I don't have any pictures to post that are more informative than the ones already posted by other travelers so I'll skip that. The Empire Palace definitely helped make our stay in Rome more enjoyable, and we appreciated that.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: dckfree
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. It is a tiny boutique hotel. The decoration is very nice, very pleasant. Front desk staff is a bit rude, but nothing too upsetting. Location is nice, lots of restaurants and bakeries around the hotel. The breakfast area and breakfast it self is fantastic! Delicious food, best cappuccino ever! Only 1 tiny little problem, the very tiny teeny room. We were in 2 and had 5 pieces of luggage (2 women with LOTS of shoes and jackets) There was barely any room for the luggage or us. Verryyyyy tiny...but comfortable. Bathroom is tiny too, but nice and warm, great shower head! Unfortunately, I wouldn't stay there again...just because I need a bigger room :)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Jen44
Reviews.Content: We were delighted to stay at the Empire Palace Hotel, given we couldn't get away from the first place we booked fast enough. Found it on wotif.com at 9.30pm at night. The staff were so nice to us - probably sympathetic due to our previous experience. We were upgraded free of charge to a large room, but only for one night and then had to retreat to a standard room following. The decor was great - but the rooms absolutely tiny so we struggled a bit as we had been on the road for some time and had a lot of luggage. The outdoor inner courtyard is a wonderful place to enjoy a fine wine at the end of the day - something we looked forward to most evenings. I would recommend it certainly. A quiet part of town and very safe which is important.

Reviews.Title: “Grea Hotel - great off season prices!”
Reviews.Author: timdevil
Reviews.Content: Just had an amazing stay at the Empire Palace Hotel. Arrived early around 10:30am and they had a room ready for us in a half hour. We had a GREAT corner room (i believe 306) - very spacious for European standards. The staff was very attentive and helpful. The included breakfast was excellent and included eggs, bacon, sausage (euro style), pastries, fruit, cereal, juices, cappucino, coffee - it was great! The hotel is one block from the 492 which takes you to most of the major sites...the roma pass is a MUST! A 10 minute walk to the Spanish steps and about 15 to the Trevi fountain. Definitely would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great for price”
Reviews.Author: JE1205
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a nice area of town, just off of the Via Venneto. The staff is polite, helpful and patient. Our room and bathroom were very clean. It was small, but most hotel rooms in Rome are... so this was okay. The staff was friendly and let us store our luggage there until checkin, they also were very attentive in bringing it to our room and getting us a cab to the train station. Travellers to Rome should note the standard cab fare to/from Fiumicino Airport to Rome is 40 EURO. We would definetely stay in this hotel again, it was the perfect place to spend the night after a long flight.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly palatial...”
Reviews.Author: lamerazure
Reviews.Content: Empire Palace is a nice hotel, centrally located to several key sites in Rome. The rooms are tastefully decorated and quite spacious. The beds are extremely uncomfortable and the sheets were like parchment paper... very uncharacteristic of a four-star property. I could hardly move in the bathroom...I think the armoire had more space! On a positive note, all employees were very accommodating and pleasant. The lobby is lovely and welcoming. Breakfast was included, though I didn't take advantage of it. This place is nice, but I will most likely stay at another hotel during my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Scottese
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews on expedia, I was a bit anxious about staying at this hotel, particularly regarding the size of the rooms. However, I can highly recommend it - I don't think some of the reviewers stayed at the same place as me!!! The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room size was absolutely fine (not huge but not as tiny as indicated by some), the beds were very comfortable and the breakfast was lovely. The location of the hotel was fantastic - a short stroll from the restaurants of via veneto and from borghese park, and the bus stops, which are at the end of the road, take you easily all around the city. All in all, a gem of a hotel - one of the elite group of Small Hotels of the World - and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Check in problem! no any answer from hotel manager about this problem”
Reviews.Author: Falctraveller
Reviews.Content: We arrive in the evening and on the reception the promise us a free up grade on junior suite room, we went on our room with the key and ... Suprise somebody was already on the room, nobody help us with the luggage and of course nobody help us with a luggages for move on the new room. Oh! of course at the and no Room up grade as promise. This Hotel is Small Leading Hotels member no any answer from the SLH about my complain (i send a email to them) and no answer from the hotel manager in Rome. Not customer Friendly a Sorry will be good isn t it? Mr. Marco

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: atlantatravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is worthy of a 5 star rating. Located near the American embassy and in an upscale and residential section of town, the hotel is an easy walk to the many sights of Rome. No loud Rome traffic noise can be heard from this hotel. The location, amenities and staff were top notch! I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near the Via Veneto!”
Reviews.Author: ceeceerose
Reviews.Content: Off a quiet little street lies this treasure...it's close to the Via Veneto, but not close enough to get all of the crowds and traffic from the famed street. A real find!

Reviews.Title: “An elegant refuge in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Vicki22
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed to the Empire Palace Hotel in Rome and were upgraded to a junior suite as a courtesy. The comfortable amenities, well-equipped bathroom and night-time turn-down service added to our enjoyment. There are a couple of restaurants in the immediate area (Locanda Bocci and Reataurant Flavia) which were excellent. The hotel restaurant looked lovely but was not busy. The breakfasts were superb. Being close to the Termini metro station, all the main sights of Rome are a couple of stops away. The staff at the Reception Desk were very helpful and eager to please.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed with this four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kittybug
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with this hotel because I was expecting so much more. It is a member of the Small Luxury Hotels of the World Group and definitely should not be. (Given the amazing quality of the other hotels in the group-I have not idea how this hotel made it in). It is an adequate, clean, fairly spacious hotel with good services. However, it is not within convenient walking distance of the sights so I really regretted staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Would Absolutely Return”
Reviews.Author: vlfrance
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for two separate stays over a two week period through Small Luxury Hotels. I believe 4 stars suits the hotel and we had a wonderful experience both stays (three nights each). The staff were friendly and helpful; the room was small as is any European hotel but very comfortable, well-appointed, and clean; the breakfast buffet is above par and the hotel restaurant and bar served tasty drinks and meals. The location was very good to try other restaurants and to reach the famous sites of Rome. We walked everywhere, took metro once and only took a cab to the Vatican; however, we enjoy walking to take it all in and perhaps we're in better shape than some (late forties). We would highly recommend the Empire Palace Hotel and only hope a future stay in Rome at this hotel will equal the wonderful experience we had there. The euro is very strong these days vs. the dollar and can make the price of a stay there seem expensive - it was well worth what we spent and we'd absolutely return.

Reviews.Title: “Not Luxury”
Reviews.Author: DZA_A
Reviews.Content: We travelled through Italy for more than 2 weeks in July. We began in Rome, travelled to Portovenere, Cinque Terre, Portofino, Bellagio - Lake Como, Venice, Florence and ended back in Rome for 2 nights. We are members of Small Luxury Hotels of the World, and routinely stay in SLH hotels, or Leading Hotels of the World. We are frequent travelers and always stay at 4 or 5 star properties. Check-in was no problem. The lobby is nice. The staff were not rude, neither were they friendly, just indifferent. We were shown to our suite and were really dissappointed. It was incredibly small and the bathroom door would not open to more than about 45 degrees because it then hit the sink. (What was the architect thinking???) The room seemed to be clean, but unfortunately there was absolutely NOTHING luxurious about the room at all. There was nowhere to put luggage either. We decided after about 5 minutes that we could not spend two nights at this hotel. We like luxury and there was NONE here. Even a small token of luxury would have been acceptable, but there was none. Or, perhaps if the staff were really friendly, it might have made a difference. We made a couple of phone calls to other hotels to enquire about availability and luckily, the Rome hotel we originally stayed at (The Inn at Roman Forum) was available. We left the hotel immediately. We cannot figure out how this hotel actually got accepted as a Small Luxury Hotel. It's not luxurious, not in a great location, there is nothing "special" about the hotel, the staff were not impressive and the room is NOT 4 star quality. I don't know, maybe their breakfast is absolutely fantastic or something.....

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, friendly, safe, central”
Reviews.Author: TheAviator2
Reviews.Content: After reading hundreds of reviews for hotels in Rome on TripAdvisor, finally settled on the Empire Palace. Empire Palace is a great mix of quality and value in a city that can be quite pricey for a nice room in the city. Most of the reviews I read were very accurate. Yes, the rooms are fairly small. Yes, the shower is small. Yes, eating dinner at the hotel is not cheap BUT it was EXCELLENT! Overall, Empire Palace was in a great location. The area around the hotel was quite quiet and in a good section of the town, near the American Embassy. I was actually surprised that the area around the hotel was as clean as it was, given it's proximity to Termini Station. At no time did we ever feel unsafe and we routinely walked back from Trevi Fountain after 10 or 11 PM. The subway (Line A) is only about a 5-10 minute walk, depending on your pace. The included breakfast was of good quality and variety, but not fantastic, as I have read in some of the other reviews. (Don't get me wrong though, nothing wrong with it and it was good.) The biggest sleeper in the hotel was the Aureliana Restaurant. We ate 3 dinners at the hotel and ALL of them were PERFECT. Superior Risotto, fillet mignon, and lamb. The wines are not overpriced and are of good variety. The staff was SUPERB! There is quite a difference in service and attentiveness between the morning and evening staff. Of particular note, Skandar from Albania (staff calls him Alex) was one of the best servers I have ever encountered in the restaurant industry. The sheets are a bit rough, but it is because they starch/press the sheets. A variety of pillow types were available and all requests were met with prompt attention. Overall, the Empire Palace was a great choice. No regrets and would definitely stay there again, while still comparing to other higher class hotels to compare prices.

Reviews.Title: “Roem and an Empire”
Reviews.Author: FlashSydney
Reviews.Content: I can't understand some of the reviews. We arrived here to be greeted warmly and our room was a decent size, complete with full size Etro toiletries including perfume. The hotel is a short walk from the Via Veneto and the Piazza della Repubblica and , unless you are obese or unfit, you can walk - as we did - to every attraction on the Monumental and Ancient Rome tours. The area is lovely and many fine restaurants, including an enoteca which allows you to taste most of the top crus of Italy, are almost next door. The breakfast buffet is lavish by Italian standards and the hotel is geared to English-speaking visitors because it has a large Italian-American clientele. The comment about not feeling safe in the area is absolute rubbish - this is prime Rome real estate and the biggest police headquarters in Rome is around the corner. The room sevice is limited but good. - especially when you were exhausted as we were after catching an early morning flight from Berlin. After a day's stroll it was wonderful to enjoy a bellini in the hotel's Corte Delle Stelle. My only "off" note would be that the porter who saw us off in the morning was monosyllabic but then so am I at 5am in the morning. A great choice for anyone who wants a true Italian experience. I would go back any day. As to the comments - it is 4 star. That's what the hotel claims to be. Loved the American Bar - complete with Philippe Starck sofas - and the Auerliano restaurant is good, if pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location....less than average rooms!”
Reviews.Author: lovethesun7
Reviews.Content: If you want to take a 15 minute cab EVERYWHERE you go then stay here...if you like Howard johnson motels...stay here. Otherwise, stay away. The hotel shockingly gets 4 stars....they deserve 2 maybe 3 if it was their lucky day,. We stayed at 4-5 star hotels in venice, florence, tuscany and positano and this hotel was way below all of the hotels we stayed at. We were very disappointed. From the pictures on the website it looks very nice, trendy even. The empire palace hotel falls short of what it looks like it promises in every way. The lobby looks like its trying very hard to be nice, but its just not. The walls look like my little cousin finger painted them. The room is TINY...Now I live in NYC so I know small but this was really tiny. Just a bed and no room for luggage. The blanket was really ratty looking and I got grossed out even thinking about putting my body on the bed. The sheets were so stiff it hurt to put my face on the pillow. The bathroom was miniature! The shower was not even a shower stall and one wouldn't believe how small it is unless they saw it. One person could barely fit into the shower and I was joking with my husband. i said what would an overweight person do if they had to shower here? I truly expected much more since my travel agent booked me here and I did investigating on my own. The website looked great and the reviews were good but this hotel really fell short. As far as the LOCATION...my biggest problem really since we weren't in the hotel too much(thank goodness). It really felt desolate and I would be afraid to walk outside there at night. We had to take cabs everywhere which was horrible. We would have liked to stay somewhere in a better location and we would have paid more if it meant being in the center or at least near the action. A huge disappointment! Do not stay at this hotel...it is VERY out of the way from everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - good location.”
Reviews.Author: kiwi400
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and very helpful. The rooms a bit on the small side but the free breakfast excelelnt. The bar has a nice protected area to sit outside. The restaurant meals were excellent. Close to Piazza Bernini and Via Veneto is right there - 5 minute walk and then maybe another 15 mins to Spanish Steps and Via Del Corso, Sistina, etc. I found it easy to get pretty much to any of the big sites - if you liek t walk. But what other way is there to see Rome? The hotel was ace...did I mention the rooms were small? Excellent wine bar riGHT NEXT DOOR! Some excellent restaurants within a 2 block radius. Many more on Via Veneto 5 mins away. Clean, good internet access. Very responsive staff. Nice work.Favorit restaurant WAY OFF the beaten track over by the Vatican near Monte Mario "Sardo" (below) a Sardinian place with unbelieveable food - great fish type dishes too. Nuraghe Sardo Viale Medaglie d'Oro, 50/1 - Tel. 06-39736584 Closed Wednesdays I think.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clevelandtravelers
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent recommended this hotel, and we were very pleased. The location is quiet, about 2 blocks from the American Embassy, but not so far from other attractions that you needed a taxi to get to everything. The staff was extremely knowledgable and helpful. The room, although not huge, was beautifully appointed, and very comfortable. The breakfast buffet was probably the best of our 3 week stay in Italy. Our package included one dinner in the hotel and that dinnr was the best we had during our stay in Rome. This hotel is not inexpensive, but the value is there because of the service and the appointments in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff but rooms really are too small”
Reviews.Author: brandenburg5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the end of April 2007. The staff are very welcoming - which I have to say is not always the case in hotels in Italy's large cities. The hotel is attractive but the double room we were given honestly is too small for two people - there wasn't room to open bags properly and you couldn't manoeuvre yourself around the bed easily. The shower itself was tiny though admittedly we have experienced similarly small shower cabins in other good hotels in Italy. We aren't very large people but found it irritating. The gym has very basic equipment - not as nice as in the Mediterraneo where we have also stayed recently, and which, all in all, is probably a better hotel in terms of room amenities and location.

Reviews.Title: “good choice of hotel in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: askandrew
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a great week-end in Rome and thoughly enjoyed our stay here at the Empire Palace. I am a Travel Agent and I do get to stay in a lot of Hotels so hopefully I can compare with others in my experience. Whilst I believe the Hotel is not quite up to the 4* plus it portrays in its web site, nevertheless I would give it a well derserved 3*+ catagory. Location is in a very good safe area of Rome, approx 8-10 minutes walk to the Presidents Palace and a further 5-10 mins to the Forum etc. Very good breakfast both continental and American style. Sorry didn't use the metro whilst i believe its very good, a lot of pickpockets on the trains. Watch out around Trevi fountain and major sites as crowds do attract these undesirable people. Rooms were very clean and well provided for with flat screen TV with internet access 5 Euro for 1 hour, good quality bathrooms etc. Some of the rooms can be small but most city centre properties I have found especially in older buildings are never large. Restaurant was very good with a la carte and set course menus, courtyard bar with accompanied piano music on an evening. Very welcome frosted glasses for the very cold beer after walking all over this great city. Good welcome from the reception staff and very helpful when called upon. - reconfirming taxi collection etc. can also recommend Romeshuttlelimousine.com for an excellant transfer 35 Euros from Fiumincino Airport., big Alfa outbound and Mercedes inbound, cheaper than metered taxi's. Did the open top bus tour, use it as a cheap way of getting around the city, 20 Euros for a 2 days ticket with headsets for the info, however as a tour not the best one I have been on. Best advice - pre-book a tour to get into the Vatican Museum and Coliseum as the queues are quite horrendous and all groups have priority at these sites. Contact me for any more info but would certainly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: retireeN.Ireland
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a good location. Walkable from Termini station in 10mins. Possible to walk to all attractions in 1 hour maximum. Hotel in quiet area where government buildings are located. Little traffic so no noise. Room was small, as reviewers suggested, but well appointed, good bathrroom and very clean. Excellent breakfast, staff pleasant. A number of good restaurants nearby. Will definitely stay here again and thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: tourbillon
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Empire palace in March. The location is very good. Although some reviewers have complained about the distance to metro, it is only a 10 minutes walk. Furthermore, several bus stops are right outside the hotel. Line 64 can take you to many places directly, and if you insist on taking the metro, either Line 64 or Line 36 will make stop at Republic metro station. It is important to remember the metro system in Rome is quite poor compare to other large cities like Paris or Shanghai. There are several fairly good places to eat around the hotel, and the resturant in hotel is very good and reasonable as well. Lunch including primo and secondi is only 22 euros without any other charge and a bottle of S. Pellegrino is free. The breakfast is also very good. A nice greek takeout place is just around corner and it has the best kebab I have ever had. It would appear the hotel is located within the Italian goverment district, and most of the places around the hotel usually only serve local. Compare to other districts in Rome, this one is very clean and quite with some nice small up-scale shops just around corner. We booked through expedia, and the room rate is very reasonable. The room itself is actually fairly large, about the same size as the room you would find in a European Hilton. The bath room is on the small side with only shower and no bath, but the bath room does have a very nice marble finish. In addition, the hotel uses ETRO soaps and shampoos, which is quite unusual and nice since ETRO is a fairly pricey name brand. Overall a very good experience, and I will be looking forward to going back to Empire palace again

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: martynhorton
Reviews.Content: We spent only three nights at this lovely hotel but could have stayed much longer. Our room was not as small as we had been led to believe by other reviews. The room was very clean and tastefully furnished. However, the positoin of our room on front of hotel meant it was very noisy from about 5am until midnight. The area around has some nice restaurants and prices are much better than in touristy areas. The food in hotel restaurant is of a high standard and worth a visit. The bar is a great place for a snack and drink. All drinks were accompanied by nuts and snacks etc. The bar staff are great and will recommend restaurants nearby. We had a great time and would return to the hotel again when visiting fantastic Roma!

Reviews.Title: “most enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: spider226
Reviews.Content: We had a most enjoyable stay at the empire palace hotel. we found the hotel facilities excellent and the staff more than accomodating. We ate at the restaurant on two nights out of our four night stay and the food was delicious and the service, very attentive. We also would like to comment on the young waiter in the blue bar who was very polite and helpful to us. The hotel is situated in a nice quiet area but is still fairly close to all the main attractions. Overall we would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone who was thinking on booking a trip to beautiful rome, in fact we have already decided to book a short trip again in april and will stay in the empire palace again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: Oliviab1217
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Feb this year as we were in Rome to celebrate my Fathers 60th. We did not tell them why we were there but the hotel noted his birth date when we arraived and when we got to our rooms in the evening they had sent him a birthday cake, which was a lovely thought. The rooms were clean, tidy and fairly spacious and the bed comfortable. The pillows were a little hard for my husband but they were fine for me. The mini bar was well stocked and not ridiculously expensive, the bar was lovely with excellent service and when you ordered drinks you were also given a selection of nibbles. We did eat in the Hotels restaurant which I have to say was lso excellent and Very Reasonably priced. All in all, if in Rome I would definately stay here again. The location is brilliant aswell, only a 10 minute walk from lots of retaurants and shops and 20 mins walk from the Trevi Fountain, when I say walk, I mean stroll.

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: Traveler714NewYork
Reviews.Content: While this is a nice hotel and the staff was very friendly and helpful, there were a couple of concerns. First was the location - while it is nice to be close to the train station, it was still a pretty far walk to any of the sites and was in a somewhat desolate area. Also, the standard rooms are really small - ours just consisted of a bed and desk. If you go in knowing those two caveats you will be fine - it is very reasonable and the common areas are very nice - the lounge and bar area was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not really a SLH”
Reviews.Author: ab75
Reviews.Content: We stay for 4 night in January. Not so bad, but the rooms are really on the small size (about 10 sq.m.), with old furniture and very cold service of the staff. When in Rome again definitly we will choose diferent place!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money comfort”
Reviews.Author: angdav
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a short Christmas holiday in Rome. We booked EPH based on Tripadvisors' reviews and we did not regret. It's comfortable, very clean, safe and friendly. Rooms are a liitle small (this is Rome actually) but the decoration is very pleasant with attention to small - but important - details (linen on bed, new fluffy towels every day, marble bathromm etc). Breakfast is very nice. Above all , people there are friendly and very helpful!! We are glad we finally did not book Excelsior (it was more expensive) which seemed to us abandonned... in a way, when we visited it . We highly recommend Empire Palace Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mumsiegene
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Empire Palace the last week in October with my daughter for a 50th birthday treat and I wasn't disappointed.The room was a good size, the bathroom was lovely, all marble and everything was spotlessly clean. The staff were friendly and very efficient, especially the Maitre d at breakfast time. He was brilliant and very cute! The location was good, everything bar the Vatican within walking distance. Good places to eat just around the corner, great food and reasonably priced. Cannot fault this hotel and am very happy to recommend it. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: pastamama1
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff. Location is not a problem as most places of interest are within walking distance with possible exception of Vatican. There is no need to book transport everywhere if you are healthy and able bodied. Good selection of food at breakfast, good sized clean room and bathroom. Several restaurants nearby offering good, reasonably priced meals and local store also just around the corner. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chiara32
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great location and friendly staff. You will not be disappointed if you stay here. Most every site is within walking distance and if not the staff is more than happy to help out with transportation, tours or whatever requests you may have. And do not forget to eat in their dining room. It is great food and wonderful service. Diana October 2006 Valencia, California

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: pha123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Empire Palace Hotel during the first week of October. The room was quite large and comfortable which was a bit shocking knowing how small other European hotel rooms can be. The staff were friendly and accomodating and provided detailed directions to all the major sites in Rome. The bathroom was extremely clean but the shower was a bit narrow and may be somewhat difficult for the "average sized" American tourist to manage. The hotel was about a 5 minute walk to the Via Veneto and about 10 minutes to the Trevi fountain and also convenient for access to Termini train station. Would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “empire was great!”
Reviews.Author: FBADad
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two night stay at this hotel. Overall, we were very pleased with this place: we loved the space in the room, the bed/pillows and linen sheets, the immaculate and spacious bathroom and Etro bath products, the serenity and quietness of the place, and the huge complimentary breakfast buffet! The staff was courteous and we particularly found the morning maitre d' at the restaurant especially charming. The location was about the only thing that was a little off/hard to figure out (not really office, not really residential, not really business - definintely off the main tourist route). But the location felt safe and wasn't too far to walk (downhill) to the Trevi fountain area, the Via Veneto area or the Spanish Steps area. We also really enjoyed the nearby La Pentolaccia restaurant around the corner from the hotel: good food and very friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ilanto
Reviews.Content: I often go to Rome on business and I usually stay here, the rooms are very small but clean and well appointed, the staff are all friendly and helpful, good breakfast buffet and good restaurant. The palace courtyard is very tranquil and the common areas are beautifully decorated. It's a 15-minute walk from the Spanish Steps and there's a large choice of transport (buses, metro...) from nearby Repubblica. Overall, reliable quality.

HotelInfo.Name: Empire Palace Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Aureliana 39 | Centre - Via Veneto, 00187 Rome, Italy
